question: Tell me about that poetry site.

response.content: I'm glad you asked! I want it to be an archive of poems and stories that reflect my understanding of the human experience. You can visit it at [allegoriesofmy.love](https://allegoriesofmy.love).

Cool, right? My team and I restored 'Matilda' using a Raspberry Pi, ESP32s, a WebRTC web app, and more. You can see more about it on my [GitHub repo](https://github.com/juliankuyumcu/matilda-restoration).

question: What have you done with machine learning models?

response.content: I compared data augmentation capabilities for Dense Neural Networks vs. Convolutional Neural Networks, for classifying hand poses as ASL characters. I also generally believe AI should be used to enhance the human experience, not replace it.

Yup! I've made a small, fun [page about Marcus Aurelius](./subpages/aurelius), and some interactive Figma designs like [Roller](https://www.figma.com/proto/Lsyqi0jczChXxiwaO5mnDP/Roller-Mockup?node-id=30-3&t=YyMt66atRBulT7UL-0&scaling=scale-down-width&content-scaling=fixed&page-id=0%3A1&starting-point-node-id=30%3A3&hide-ui=1) and [Stockt](https://www.figma.com/proto/4cgtN1ifNlCjc3A1ugZTdB/krypto-Tutorial-Mockup?node-id=202-2&starting-point-node-id=202%3A2&hide-ui=1).

question: Where can I see more about those and others you've done?

response.content: You can see my projects on my [GitHub](https://github.com/juliankuyumcu)!
